name: Business Development RFP Pipeline
description: Complete BD workflow: Opportunity qualification, competitive intel, past performance, pricing analysis, teaming strategy, and bid/no-bid recommendation

evidenceRequirements.description: Executive opportunity brief with key facts
Competitive intelligence: likely competitors, past winners, pricing ranges
Past awards in this NAICS/agency with values and winners
Gap analysis: what we have vs what's required
Executive BD memo: Bid/No-Bid recommendation with full justification

variables.name: MAX_CONTRACT_VALUE
variables.description: Maximum contract value we can handle (e.g., 10000000)

steps.instruction: Navigate to SAM.gov contract opportunities search

steps.expectedOutcome: RFP listing displayed with full details

steps.instruction: Extract core opportunity data: solicitation number, title, agency, sub-agency, NAICS code, set-aside type, response deadline, estimated value (if listed), point of contact

Qualification check: (1) Is contract value in our range (${MIN_CONTRACT_VALUE} - ${MAX_CONTRACT_VALUE})? (2) Do we hold the required NAICS code? (3) Can we meet the set-aside requirements? (4) Is deadline realistic (>30 days preferred)?
Download all RFP attachments: solicitation document, statement of work, amendments, Q&A responses
steps.expectedOutcome: All documents downloaded to controlled storage

steps.instruction: Parse solicitation document to extract: technical requirements, deliverables, performance period, key personnel requirements, required certifications, security clearance needs, evaluation criteria
Compare our capabilities (NAICS: ${OUR_NAICS_CODES}, Certifications: ${OUR_CERTIFICATIONS}) against requirements. Identify gaps: missing certifications, staffing needs, teaming needs
steps.expectedOutcome: Gap analysis with specific missing capabilities

steps.instruction: Navigate to USASpending.gov to research past awards
Search for past awards to ${AGENCY} in the same NAICS code over last 3 years. Extract: winner companies, contract values, award dates, contract types (FFP, T&M, CPFF)
steps.expectedOutcome: List of comparable past awards with values and winners

steps.instruction: Analyze past winners to identify likely competitors. For top 3-5 competitors, extract: company size, geographic presence, past performance with this agency, typical contract values
steps.expectedOutcome: Competitive landscape analysis with likely bidders

steps.instruction: From past awards data, calculate: median award value, min/max range, typical contract type, average period of performance. Use this for pricing guidance.
steps.expectedOutcome: Pricing intelligence with budget range recommendation

steps.instruction: Based on capability gaps, identify potential teaming partners. Prioritize partners who: (1) Fill our gaps, (2) Have past performance with this agency, (3) Have complementary capabilities, (4) Are not direct competitors

Calculate win probability based on: (1) Past performance with agency (0-25 pts), (2) Technical capability match (0-25 pts), (3) Competitive positioning (0-25 pts), (4) Price competitiveness (0-25 pts). Score 0-100.
Identify risks: (1) Capability gaps, (2) Aggressive timeline, (3) Strong competition, (4) Pricing uncertainty, (5) Teaming complexity. Rate each risk as Low/Medium/High.

Generate Executive BD Decision Memo with sections: (1) EXECUTIVE SUMMARY (Bid/No-Bid recommendation), (2) OPPORTUNITY OVERVIEW, (3) QUALIFICATION ANALYSIS, (4) COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE, (5) CAPABILITY GAP ANALYSIS, (6) TEAMING STRATEGY, (7) PRICING GUIDANCE, (8) WIN PROBABILITY, (9) RISK ASSESSMENT, (10) RECOMMENDATION & NEXT STEPS
steps.expectedOutcome: Formatted BD memo ready for executive review

_bd_workflow_notes.parallel_execution: Steps 8-11 (past performance, competitive intel, pricing) can run in parallel for speed
_bd_workflow_notes.qualification_gates: If qualification fails at step 4, skip to final memo with NO-BID recommendation
_bd_workflow_notes.teaming_triggers: If capability gaps > 30%, teaming is REQUIRED

bid_thresholds.fast_track: Win probability > 70% and no major gaps
